pages.text: Pteridinium comes from the late Ediacaran, with fossils found in a wide range of formations across the globe, with the first fossils found in Newfoundland, Canada. It is a 3 lobed, boat-shaped lifeform found in shallow waters and could grow up to 20 cm in length, and possibly partook in filter feeding from the surrounding water.

The generic name derives from the Greek word 'pt√©ris', to mean 'fern'. Pteridium was the original generic name, but as this had already been given to an extant bracken fern, the name was altered slightly to what we have today.
